text: In countries where the temperature falls below 273K, salt is always sprinkled on the icy road in order to

increase the density of the ice
raise the melting point of the ice

subject: CHEMISTRY

explanation.text:
Explanation
2Na(s) + 2H2O(l) → 2NaOH(aq) + H2(g)
Relative molecular mass of NaOH = 23 + 16 + 1 = 40smol-1
2 * 23g of sodium react with water to produce 
2 * 40g of NaOH
∴ 2.3g of sodium will react with water to produce
(2.3 * 40 * 2)/(23 * 2) = 4.00g

text:
2Na(s) + 2H2O(l) → 2NaOH(aq) + H2(g)
From the equation above, calculate the mass of sodium hydroxide produced by 2.3g of sodium.
[H = 1, O = 16, Na = 23]
subject: CHEMISTRY

explanation.text:
Explanation
2NaHCO3(s) → Na2CO3(s) + H2O(l) + CO2
Relative molecular mass of NaHCO3 = 23 +1 + 12 + 16 * 3 = 84smol-1
2 * 84g of NaHCO3 will be liberated 22.4dm3 or CO2 at s.t.p
16.8g of NaHCO3 will libertae (16.8 * 22.4)/(2 * 84) = 2.24 dm3

text:
16.8 g of sodium hydrogen trioxocarbonate (IV) is completely decomposed by heat. Calculate the volume of carbon(IV) oxide given off s.t.p 
[Na 23, C = 12, O = 16, H = 1, Molar volume of a gas at s.t.p = 22.4 dm3]

explanation.text:
Explanation
An insoluble salt can be prepared by a precipitation method through a double decomposition reaction.
Two soluble metal salts react with each other to form one soluble salt and one insoluble salt .
Lead nitrate solution and sodium chloride solution react to produce solid lead chloride , leaving soluble sodium nitrate in solution.
The lead chloride can be recovered by filtration.

text: Insoluble salts can be prepared by?

reacting an acid with trioxocarbonate (IV) salt
directing combination of the elements which make up the salt
mixing two soluble compounds containing the metallic radical and the acidic radical

X = 4 - 2 = +2

text: The IUPAC nomenclature for the structure above is
subject: CHEMISTRY

explanation.text:
Explanation
% of H2 = 100 - 92.3 = 7.7%
mole = Carbon [92.3 / 12] = 7.7
            Hydrogen [7.7 / 1] = 7.7
divide with the lowest:

Carbon - 7.1 / 7.1 = 1
Hydrogen  - 7.1 / 7.1 = 1

empirical formula = CH

(CH)n = 26
(12 + 1)n = 26
(13)n = 26
n = 26/13 = 2

molecular formula = C\(_2\)H\(_2\)
